questions.text: A 47-year-old patient came to the ENT OPD with complaints of difficulty in swallowing, hoarseness of voice, and long-lasting cough. Various investigations were done, and it was found out to be carcinoma larynx. A permanent tracheostomy was done in this patient after a total laryngectomy. Now the patient was concerned about his voice. Which of the following options is correct for voice rehabilitation options in this patient after a permanent tracheostomy?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above The correct answer is all of the above.

Highyeild:

Various ways for voice rehabilitation after permanent tracheostomy are 1. Phonosurgeey 2. Muir valve 3. Esophageal speech 4. Tracheoesophageal speech 5. Electrolarynx 6. Transoral pneumatic device

questions.text: Which of the following option is incorrect regarding the image given below?

options.label: A
options.text: Used in tracheostomy with normal larynx for speech rehabilitation

options.label: B
options.text: It allows air to go in and doesn’t allow air to come out.

options.label: C
options.text: Patient cannot speak for a longer duration

questions.correct_answer: C. Patient cannot speak for a longer duration
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Patient cannot speak for a longer duration The given image is of the Passy Muir valve. The patient can speak longer There is no need to close the opening.

Highyeild:

PASSY MUIR VALVE It has the following features. 1. It is used in tracheostomy with normal larynx for speech rehabilitation 2. It only allows air to go in and doesn’t allow air to come out 3. Its valve has a diaphragm 4. Patient can speak longer, and there is no need to close the opening.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. It is used in tracheostomy with normal larynx for speech rehabilitation is a true statement. Option: B. It only allows air to go in and doesn’t allow air to come out Option: D. It’s valve has a diaphragm

Extraedge:

Humidity can be used with the valve in place. Oxygen can be given with the valve in place Remove the valve during aerosol treatment. If it is left on, remove it and rinse it to remove any medications that could cause the valve to stick or not work well.

questions.text: Which of the following options are incorrect regarding the disadvantages of the image given below?

options.label: B
options.text: Cleaning Of the diaphragm is required at regular intervals.

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: C. Can be used along with the cuffed tube.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Can be used along with the cuffed tube. The given image is of the Passy Muir valve. It cannot be used along with the cuffed tube.

Highyeild:

Various disadvantages of the Passy Muir valve are as follows. 1. Its valve can get blocked easily 2. Cleaning of the diaphragm is required at regular intervals 3. It cannot be used along with cuffed tube

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Its valve can get blocked easily is a true statement. Option: B. Cleaning of the diaphragm is required at regular intervals is also a true statement.

Extraedge:

Humidity can be used with the valve in place. Oxygen can be given with the valve in place Remove the valve during aerosol treatment. If it is left on, remove it and rinse it to remove any medications that could cause the valve to stick or not work well.

questions.text: A 52 year old patient underwent a tracheostomy procedure last week as indicated for the disease he suffered with. He was concerned for his voice. So for his speech rehabilitation doctors prescribed him passy Muir valve. For the proper care of the valve, doctors told him some precautions. Which of the following options is incorrect for properly caring for the valve?

options.label: A
options.text: Clean the valve daily with mild soapy water.

options.label: B
options.text: Rinse the valve with cold water and not hot water

options.label: C
options.text: Clean the valve with alcohol or peroxide solution

options.label: D
options.text: Replace the valve when it becomes sticky.

questions.correct_answer: C. Clean the valve with alcohol or peroxide solution
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Clean the valve with alcohol or peroxide solution Do not use a brush, vinegar, peroxide, bleach, or alcohol on the valve.

Highyeild:

The precautions must be taken for the proper care of the Passy Muir valve. 1. Clean the valve daily with mild soapy water 2. Rinse with cool to warm water. Hot water may damage the valve 3. Let the valve air dry completely before using it again 4. Do not use a brush, vinegar, peroxide, bleach, or alcohol on the valve 5. Replace the valve when it becomes sticky, noisy, or vibrates.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Clean the valve daily with mild soapy water is a true statement. Option: B. Rinse with cool to warm water. Hot water may damage the valve. Option: D. Replace the valve when it becomes sticky is a true statement.
